title: Mouse pointer keeps spinning for up to 40 seconds after launch
content:
I am running Debian 10 Linux and recently upgraded Firefox ESR to version 78.3.0 . I noticed that whenever I launch Firefox that the mouse pointer "spins" for up to 40 seconds after launch. This does not seem to affect usability but is visually unpleasant. I have done the following things: 1. Start in Safe Mode: The spinning mouse pointer is no longer spinning after launch. 2. Disabled all plugins and extension and launch Firefox: The pointer keeps spinning. 3. Downloaded Firefox 80 and launched: Pointer keeps spinning. 4. Changed home page to a blank screen: Pointer keeps spinning. 5. Uninstalled Firefox ESR and re-installed: Pointer keeps spinning. 6. Checked for viruses, trojans, and other malware: none found.

Interestingly, if I launch Firefox ESR from a terminal (eg "firefox-esr &") the spinning mouse pointer is not present. HMMMM! This is the command that is used in the desktop icon: /usr/lib/firefox-esr/firefox-esr %u . Is there a problem with that command. I may modify that command and see what happens. Feedback would be appreciated.

title: Updates to Firefox on MacOS
content:
Just a suggestion on getting update content information.

I do not enable automatic updates in order to maintain personal update control and to generally wait a few days to allow any bugs in the update to shake out [e.g 81.0.2 to fix the Twitter bug in 81.0.1 -- No biggie, small bugs can crop-up in any update in spite of Mozilla's commendable quality control]. When manually checking Firefox "About" to look at update status, the pop-up shows the current installed version, with a link to "What's new?" [Great idea, thanks]. Unfortunately, there is not a "What's new?" link beside the box to download a new update, thus one must do an on-line search for the related Release Note to determine the urgency/relevancy of doing the update.

Adding an additional "What's new?" would be an appreciated change -- Thanks and be well.
creator: JohnfromMA

title: Al minimizar Firefox, queda en segundo plano y se ve en la barra de tareas,al darle click, no levanta el navegador

title: Trickle ICE waiting for all ICE candidates to be finished
content:
Hi there,

I'm using WebRTC to establish calls. However, I notice a huge delay in the gathering of ICE, which doesn't happen in Chrome.

It seems to be due to Firefox's WebRTC Framework waiting for all ICE candidate to "finish" (either connect or timeout), rather than using the first ICE that successfully connects.

To my understanding, the latter should be done when the browser uses the Trickle ICE technique, which according to "about:webrtc", all remote candidates are using by being blue.

Perhaps the local candidates also need to be in blue? (trickled)

Thanks in advance.

Regards,

David Gomes

title: Problem using Facebook  "Pages"
content:
Hi everyone,

It has been a long time I didn't use Facebook. A few days ago, I needed to create a Facebook page for my business. Unfortunately, everytime, it gets me to this Facebook URL telling that "Sorry, something went wrong. We're working on getting this fixed as soon as we can".

I quickly realised it was working on Edge, Firefox for Android and Chrome...

So, I went back to my Firefox for Windows and disabled all the tracking protections, allowed every cookies, trackers, etc ... I deleted cache and cookies, made sure I had no extensions blocking, and no exceptions. Then I started Firefox again. Same issue... I tried to create my Facebook page from a private navigation tab but it wasn't any better. Same issue again.

I really don't want to switch to another browser, but this is making me really confused, I don't undersand where the glitch comes from. I hope some of you will be able to help, that would be really nice.

I reckon this topic may be about the same issue: https://support.mozilla.org/fr/questi.../1295896

content:

content: I have used Bing with no problems for years now, recently it has been giving a banner at the top whenever I use it stating that a website is slowing the browser, then options stop or wait. I cannot click the three bar link for more options, change the safe search option, or sign in to my Microsoft account. All these links are dead. When on a page I cannot use the filter link. I also cannot click on anything at all while the banner notice is up. I have tried to get help form Microsoft and they were unable to do anything. They suggested using their browser Edge. They suggested emptying the cache, which I did with no change, and they suggested uninstalling Firefox and reinstalling it. I do not want to do this because it will destroy al my formatting and lose lots of links, etc... as it has every other time I have done this. I hope someone here will be able to help me. I prefer Bing search engine to all the others. I have tried Google and DuckDuckGo and they do not work for me, or find what I am searching for as well as Bing has. The others seem to be more for purchasing and not searching and so I do not like or trust them. Using Windows 10 on a Desk top PC, and had no trouble with Bing until the last week or so.

title: Firefox is no longer retaining tab history and is not loading the start page
content: Hi, something happened recently with an update or something where Restore Previous Session is grayed out, the start page is not loading, and tab icons are lost as I'm forced to use Tab Session Manager every time I'm forced to close Firefox to restart it due to lag or something. I'm currently in Firefox 81.0 and it is making we want to find someone who can help me downgrade to Firefox 70 or Firefox 50 depending on when the issue started or where something got broken with an update. I think what is going on is you are rushing to get updates out to compete against someone else and that is leading to random issues, and that needs to change as you need to stop worrying about whether or not you lose users. Right now, I can't even use Facebook share anymore and is making me want to switch to a different browser because of this.
creator: erikmouse1

title: Can the FF 81.0 Menu bar be duplicated in the hamburger menu?
content: IMHO, the Hamburger menu should be the duplicate of the Menu bar. That way one could gain vertical display space by hiding the Menu bar. After all, the some of the Menu bar options are already duplicated, but not the ones I could use. Why not go all the way and let users gain the extra display space?
creator: ineuw

title: Firefox SYNC
content:
Hello,

wondering if I could suggest the option of adding a SKIP or not now as every time I setup a new device it tries to "setup" sync on mobile devices but I have it on all my mobiles already and need no additional one so end up getting messages for the next few days after every reinstall on testing device I use at work. could we allow not trying to push to mobile or at least check if your already synced on mobile before trying to add a new mobile?

Cheers
creator: arron27

title: Home page and search engine
content: I had Bing as my homepage and search engine, and that has always worked fine, for many years. But after a recent Firefox update, the browser will no longer allow Bing as my homepage and search engine, and because I had set the browser exclusively for Bing, I can't access another search engine. I liked the Bing homepage because it had a new photo every day, and most of those photos were downloadable to use as wallpapers. Looks like I may go back to Internet Explorer [I don't like Edge]. Why won't Firefox allow Bing now? - it's not a security risk.
creator: ariari84

title: Firefox Account 2FA not working
content:
Hi,

I am trying to enable "Two-step Authentication" under the Manage Account page for my Firefox Account.

I've tried many authenticator / otp app on my android phone and my friend's android phone just to see, but none of them would work. It always says "Invalid two-step authentication code".

Has anyone been experiencing this? Does anyone have a lead on how to fix this?

Thank you!
creator: rachot

title: managing my browser
content: In the search settings it has "Your browser is being managed by your organisation", what is that about? I don't belong to any organisation, and want to manage my own browser.
creator: ariari84

title: Cant move Firefox windows between mac desktops
content:
I am unable to move firefox windows between my mac desktops. When I attempt to move a firefox window to a a different desktop I receive a grayed out circle with a line though it and the move will not complete. When I have a firefox window open and move between desktops without selecting the firefox window all open firefox windows come with me and cover whatever was open on that Desktop. My other applications are all moving/not moving as before.

I am using firefox 81.0.1 and Mac OS 10.15.7

thank you!
creator: matthewsienkiewicz

title: YT says the browser does not recognize any videoformats
content:
Sry the message is German but I will translate it hopefully similar to the English output. I try to open this video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCcjRePrSj4 Mind you other seem to work fine and I get this issue:

"Dein Browser erkennt zurzeit keines der verfügbaren Videoformate. Klicke hier, um unsere häufig gestellten Fragen zu HTML5-Videos aufzurufen."

Basically says "Your Browser does not recognize any available videoformat Click here, for FAQ around HTML5-Videos"

links to https://www.youtube.com/supported_browsers which literally shows Firefox as supported. I run Firefox on Ubuntu20.04 here and I have no clue what the issue could be. Chromium works. It works on Windows. I tried the safe mode without success. I just want to fix this before I run into this more frequently.

I am utterly clueless. I just today installed Firefox again on my Ubuntu machine. All issues I could find so far seem to be at least 2 years or older...
creator: pieberalexander

title: Youtube not staying signed in between videos
content: I had recently re-imaged my PC and now Firefox does not like to keep YouTube signed in. I watch a video and go back I have to sign in again, I click on subscriptions I have to sign in again. I cannot comment or subscribe to anything. I have tried every common fix for this. I have tried clearing cookies and cache, forgetting website, clearing history I even used software to remove every bit of Firefox in my system right down to registry. I have tried turning off windows defender and virus scanner no change. Tried Firefox it in safe mode with same results. It works fine in Chrome I really would like an answer to this because I am not going to become a lemming and just use chrome!
creator: jarack1

title: How do I prevent a site's JS from changing the context menu?
content: A few websites I use change the context menu (right-click menu), and I'd like to know how to prevent them from doing so. I haven't been able to find JavaScript settings anywhere in FF.
creator: mehness77
